flow.descriptionCdata:
ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.090bf14d-65c6-4bdf-8de6-f650ab042808.description=
Gets the DN of the root domain in active directory.

Inputs\:
host - An active directory domain controller.
altuser - The user to authenticate to host as.
altpass - The password for altuser.

Responses\:
success - DN retrieved successfully.
failure - Unable to retrieve DN.

Results\:
domainDN - the distinguished name of the root domain
ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.0bcc0cc4-24ac-4573-a4fa-bf62ebcd9595.prompt=Enter a value for domain ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.1808e6a6-f48f-42ab-94c2-842e3764a4aa.description=
Searches for specific properties in LDAP. Returns a list of the values of the given properties for the first object that passes the filter (given in the corresponding input). The rest of the property values (for the other objects) are stored in a collection that is accessible via the LDAP Search Next Result operation.

Input Parameters\:
host - name or IP address of LDAP server to query. Can also be used in the form " host\:port"
dn - base DN for search
filter - search filter (see Note section)
propertyNames - names of properties to return (ex. distinguishedName,telephoneNumber)
username - name of user to connect to LDAP as
password - password of user
port - specify the port in case it is not the default one, or it is not specified in the host path
delimiter - a delimiter to separate the property names in the input and the property values in the result; if no value is assigned the delimiter is set to "," by default
useADAuth - add this input and set to false if using a non AD LDAP server. If false, uses ServerBind instead of secure NTLM based bind.
searchScope - the scope for doing the search. Permitted values\: Base -limits the search to the base object-, OneLevel -searches the immediate child objects of the base object, excluding the base object- or Subtree -searches the whole subtree, including the base object and all its child objects-. If the scope of a directory search is not specified, a Subtree type of search is performed. 

Responses\:
object(s) retrieved - was able to retrieve objects and property values from LDAP. First value returned as returnResult result
no objects found - no objects were found
failure - an invalid or duplicate property name was provided or an error occured. See returnResult for more information

Note\:
The filter input can be a simple filter, or a composed one. The filter can be composed by the rules described in "RFC2254 - The String Representation of LDAP Search Filters" which can be found at http\://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2254.html.  

Example of valid filters\:
member\=CN\=User1,CN\=Users,DC\=mydomain,DC\=local
(|(numsubordinates\=1)(entryid\=15))
(&(mobile\=*)(name\=abcd))
(&(objectClass\=Person)(|(sn\=Jensen)(cn\=Babs J*)))
ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.1af2ab28-52e4-494b-8989-31b63990c455.prompt=Alternate Credentials - UserName\: ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.34db3e5c-5fc8-4e7e-b4b5-8c0aeeae03bc.prompt=Alternate Credentials - Password\: ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.3b4eac6c-fd2c-4292-9ca7-dfcab91a1014.prompt=Alternate Credentials - Password\: ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.42c38680-f370-45c2-8cd1-cabcb528b915.description=
Finds the primary domain controller for a domain via DNS lookup.

Inputs\:
domain - The name of the domain to find the domain controller for.
dnsServer - The DNS server to query.

Responses\:
success - PDC retrieved.
failure - something went wrong.

Returns\:
The fully qualified host name of the PDC.
ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.49848d74-c9f2-49b7-8ae2-fc6f48110c71.description=
Searches for specific properties in LDAP. Returns a list of the values of the given properties for the first object that passes the filter (given in the corresponding input). The rest of the property values (for the other objects) are stored in a collection that is accessible via the LDAP Search Next Result operation.

Input Parameters\:
host - name or IP address of LDAP server to query. Can also be used in the form " host\:port"
dn - base DN for search
filter - search filter (see Note section)
propertyNames - names of properties to return (ex. distinguishedName,telephoneNumber)
username - name of user to connect to LDAP as
password - password of user
port - specify the port in case it is not the default one, or it is not specified in the host path
delimiter - a delimiter to separate the property names in the input and the property values in the result; if no value is assigned the delimiter is set to "," by default
useADAuth - add this input and set to false if using a non AD LDAP server. If false, uses ServerBind instead of secure NTLM based bind.
searchScope - the scope for doing the search. Permitted values\: Base -limits the search to the base object-, OneLevel -searches the immediate child objects of the base object, excluding the base object- or Subtree -searches the whole subtree, including the base object and all its child objects-. If the scope of a directory search is not specified, a Subtree type of search is performed. 

Responses\:
object(s) retrieved - was able to retrieve objects and property values from LDAP. First value returned as returnResult result
no objects found - no objects were found
failure - an invalid or duplicate property name was provided or an error occured. See returnResult for more information

Note\:
The filter input can be a simple filter, or a composed one. The filter can be composed by the rules described in "RFC2254 - The String Representation of LDAP Search Filters" which can be found at http\://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2254.html.  

Example of valid filters\:
member\=CN\=User1,CN\=Users,DC\=mydomain,DC\=local
(|(numsubordinates\=1)(entryid\=15))
(&(mobile\=*)(name\=abcd))
(&(objectClass\=Person)(|(sn\=Jensen)(cn\=Babs J*)))
ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.4b8a0886-850e-40ff-be8c-f43baed70fdc.prompt=User sAMAccountName\: ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.691256ae-62c8-47fd-927b-d1af539f62bf.prompt=Enter a value for dnsServer ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.82c0164c-49e4-4683-965a-04b85ec6b593.description=Check the current date and time, and returns a java DateAndTime formatted string of it. Responses\: success - Date/time retrieved successfully. failure - Date/time could not be retrieved. ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.b6fe241f-257e-4045-a003-e6924d686ac4.description=
Converts an string date time to an Active Directory Time Stamp (Integer8)

Input Parameters\:
adTimeStamp - string representation of the time stamp returned by ad

Responses\:
Passed - converted successfully (value is op result)
Failed - failed to convert
ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.b7556adc-628c-4f2e-aeb5-598b2a019761.description=
Executes an Expression (e.x value1 \=\= value2)

Input Parameters\:
value1 - the value to threshold with
value2 - the threshold to threshold against
operator - (\=\=, \!\=,  >, >\=, <, <\=) the type of threshold
okstring - string to push into returnResult if the threshold has not been passed
failedstring - string to push into the returnResult if the threshold has been passed

Responses\:
True - the expression is true
Fales - the expression is false
ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.b9691ece-5db3-4e70-8937-3a1f8a48669a.prompt=Alternate Credentials - UserName\: ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.description=
Finds the primary domain controller for a domain via DNS lookup and checks to see if an account is locked.

Inputs\:
    domain - The name of the domain whose domain controller you want to find
    dnsServer - The DNS server to query
    mbuser -The value of the sAMAccountName attribute of the user whose mailbox is checked
    altuser - The username to use when authenticating with the host
    altpass - The password for altuser

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully
ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.f1c21680-8056-41c4-8ce9-2409f2830653.prompt=DNSserver\: ae98939e-9dbf-4b86-a3d4-bbbd9890cd93.f8135e84-0eef-4235-b7cd-4aab66711469.prompt=Domain\:
